thread.title: A Nile Cruise With Retro-Glamour Appeal

author: Tara Isabella Burton
title: A Nile Cruise With Retro-Glamour Appeal
text:
OLD IS GOOD, Madame,” an Egyptian tourist told me, nodding vigorously. She’d stopped me among the ruins at Karnak, the monumental temple complex built 4,000 years ago during Egypt’s triumphant Middle Kingdom period. She gestured again to the broken columns. “Old is good.”
The same lesson had been impressed on me many times that week as I traveled from Luxor to Aswan on the SS Sudan, the Nile’s last remaining steamboat. A floating grand hotel, the Sudan was first built in 1885 as a private vessel for King Fuad before being...
